page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: South of Grouville Common, for many years a golf course, are the districts known as Fauvic and La Rocque. Within these districts the residential area forms a ribbon which follows the coastline, while inland the land is used for horticulture. Traditionally, fishing and tomato-growing were the main occupations followed, but the area now owes virtually nothing to these industries. The nature of the local horticultural industry has changed, and the industries to which the residents look for a living have lost their "local" character and are much the same as those followed elsewhere in the island.
